name: Add sub-settings
description:
Adds into existing settings JSON new sub-JSON for sub-settings.
Though we suppose that this function will be used with settings JSONs, it can be applied to any correct JSON.

in_ports.name: settings
in_ports.hint: If not specified, an empty JSON is supposed.

in_ports.name: sub-settings
in_ports.hint: If not specified, an empty JSON is supposed.

controls.caption: Sub-settings name
controls.name: subSettingsName
controls.description: New sub-settings JSON will be added to existing JSON as JSON section, named "@" + this name. For example, sub-settings name "xxxParameters" will produce JSON object named "@xxxParameters". (Note that usual parameters in the settings combiner cannot start with @ character.)

controls.caption: What to do if this sub-settings already exists?
controls.name: replaceExistingSettingsMode
controls.description: Note that all modes are equivalent if existing settings JSON has no sub-section with key name, specified in the previous parameter.

items.caption: Simple: existing JSON section is fully replaced
Preserve existing entries and add new ones
Override existing entries and add new ones
Override existing entries, but not add new ones

controls.caption: Use "@" prefix
controls.name: useSubSettingsPrefix
controls.description: If set, sub-settings with name "xxxParameters" are represented by JSON object named "@xxxParameters", as described above. If cleared, this function does not add "@". It can be useful for processing usual JSON files (not settings).
